subject: Re: [junit] Testing the exception
msgSnippet: ... plz search with Google. I used keywords junit expected exception -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca Your guide to software craftsmanship
messageBody:
On Thu, Aug 7, 2008 at 7:51 AM, Swapnil <swap_masane@...> wrote:
> I havae a method :
>
> try{
> result=instance.getResult();
> }catch(Exception actualException)
> {
>
> //do something
> }
> NullPointerException expectedException = new NullPointerException;
>
> assertEquals(expectedException, actualException);
>
> getResult has a exception at some statement which has already been
> caught in the getResult itself. I want that the assertEquals should
> catch the excepton.
> what to do?
> plz help

plz search with Google. I used keywords 'junit expected exception'
